Name: Andijan
Description: Located in the Fergana Valley, Andijan is known for its agricultural and industrial output, particularly cotton production.

Name: Bukhara
Description: A historical city and province known for its rich cultural heritage, including ancient architectural landmarks along the Silk Road.

Name: Jizzakh
Description: Located in central Uzbekistan, Jizzakh is known for its agricultural products and industries, as well as its historical significance.

Name: Karakalpakstan
Description: A semi-autonomous republic located in the western part of Uzbekistan, known for its unique culture and proximity to the Aral Sea.

Name: Kashkadarya
Description: Known for its agricultural production, especially cotton, and its scenic landscapes with mountain ranges and deserts.

Name: Khorezm
Description: Situated in the northwestern part of the country, Khorezm has a rich history and is known for the city of Urgench and the Khiva historical site.

Name: Navoi
Description: Located in the central part of Uzbekistan, Navoi is an important industrial region, known for its mining and the city of the same name.

Name: Namangan
Description: Located in the Fergana Valley, Namangan is known for its textile industry and vibrant cultural heritage.

Name: Samarkand
Description: A region famous for its historical significance as a major city on the Silk Road, with its capital Samarkand being a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

Name: Sirdarya
Description: Sirdarya is known for its agriculture, particularly cotton farming, and is situated in the eastern part of the country near the Syr Darya River.

Name: Tashkent
Description: The capital region, including the city of Tashkent, which is the largest city in Uzbekistan and an important cultural, political, and economic hub.

Name: Surxondaryo
Description: Located in the southern part of Uzbekistan, Surxondaryo is known for its agricultural production and proximity to the border with Tajikistan and Afghanistan.

Name: Fergana
Description: A fertile and populous region located in the Fergana Valley, known for its agricultural output, particularly cotton, and cultural significance.
